def_en: If you have an account with a bank or a similar organization, you have an arrangement to leave your money there and take some out when you need it.

def_cn: 固定客户，老主顾（尤指公司）
def_en: In business, a regular customer of a company can be referred to as an account, especially when the customer is another company.
Accounts are detailed records of all the money that a person or business receives and spends.

def_cn: （书面或口头的）记述，描述，陈述，报告
def_en: An account is a written or spoken report of something that has happened.
An account of something is a theory which is intended to explain or describe it.
If you say that something is accounted a particular thing, you are reporting someone's judgment or opinion that it is that thing.
accounting; bank account; current account; deposit account; joint;
If you say that something is true by all accounts or from all accounts, you believe it is true because other people say so.

def_cn: （尽管未必大获全胜但）出色地表现（自己）
def_en: If you say that someone gave a good account of themselves in a particular situation, you mean that they performed well, although they may not have been completely successful.
If you say that something is of no account or of little account, you mean that it is very unimportant and is not worth considering.

def_cn: 以赊账方式;以分期付款方式
def_en: If you buy or pay for something on account, you pay nothing or only part of the cost at first, and pay the rest later.
You use on account of to introduce the reason or explanation for something.

def_cn: 从（某人的）角度；（尤指）设想处于（某人的）情况
def_en: Your feelings on someone's account are the feelings you have about what they have experienced or might experience, especially when you imagine yourself to be in their situation.
If you tell someone not to do something on your account, you mean that they should do it only if they want to, and not because they think it will please you.
If you say that something should on no account be done, you are emphasizing that it should not be done under any circumstances.
You can use on that account or on this account when you want to say that something happens for the reason you have just mentioned.
If you say that something concerning a particular person is true by his or her own account, you mean that you believe it because that person has said it is true.

def_cn: 作为个人地；为自身利益地
def_en: If you take part in a business activity on your own account, you do it for yourself, and not as a representative or employee of a company.

def_cn: 自主自愿地;责任自负地
def_en: If you do something on your own account, you do it because you want to and without being asked, and you take responsibility for your own action.

def_cn: （与敌人或对手）决战，算账，了结恩怨
def_en: To settle accounts with an enemy or opponent means to bring your fight or quarrel to an end by defeating them.
If you take something into account, or take account of something, you consider it when you are thinking about a situation or deciding what to do.

def_cn: （对所做的错事）被要求解释并遭斥责，被问责
def_en: If someone is called, held, or brought to account for something they have done wrong, they are made to explain why they did it, and are often criticized or punished for it.
